ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course combines histology with cell biology and serves pretty good as an introduction to physiology.
It is a very good course to learn cell biology at a system level and very interesting because it has a lot of disease-related topic. I would recommend.
Yes, this course is very useful.

I would definitely recommend this course to another student. It's low-stress, really interesting, and you get an awesome breadth of material in one class. You may get frustrated if you're expecting super in-depth information, but if you'd just like to get a sense for the cell bio behind body systems, this is the course for you. Awesome profs and great guest lecturers!
It's a brief overview of each organ system in the body. Histology for each system is learned as well. I would definitely recommend the course to anyone who has an interest in human disease.
I would definitely recommend this course to other student.
Yes, this is a really fun cell biology course.

Gives you an introduction to cell types throughout the body, and you get a chance to examine these visually. Easy course, though I wouldn't recommend it to someone looking to gain a very specific knowledge set.
This class provides a good physiological view of Cell Biology, in more of a systems context. Good for students who are interested in how various systems function.
Yes I would recommend the course.

Yes I would definitely recommend this course if you are interested in histology and learning about how disease affects the function and structure of systems in the human body.It is a great atmosphere to learn in with both lectures and labs, and lots of support from the instructors and TA.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Not much to the research. But good in general.
I learned broad topics about cells in different tissues and systems. The lectures are given by professors who are experts in their fields and the knowledge is up-dated.
It makes me better understand many biogical processes in different tissue, organ, systems. It's really helpful!
This class was not relevant to my research. However, it was an area I was interested in and gave me an good overview and understanding of the subject.
It was a bit useful to look at some histology of cell types that I might end up studying and doing histology on myself.
This course helped me with understanding other systems in the body besides the immune system.
Because this course had a broad focus, I feel that much of what I learned in this course may be applicable to my future research.

I think it is too early to see to what extent the course contributed to my research, but it gave me a lot of background information. It gave many great examples of how structure affects function and really made it clear that human systems rely on this connection.
